scenarioDescription:
The DH Tau Exoplanetary System


Overview

DH Tau is a star with 0.33 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.27 times its radius. It is located 439.81 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.001 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

DH Tau is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the DH Tau system


DH Tau b

DH Tau b was discovered by the Subaru Telescope observatory, in 2005-02, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 330.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of DH Tau b is 3498.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of DH Tau b is 30.264 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, DH Tau b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system DH Tau, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Subaru Telescope.
name: DH Tau - System With 1 Exoplanet
